#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Invest with an Equity Linked Savings Scheme
#Text=Equity Linked Savings Schemes ( ELSS ) are diversified equity schemes offered by mutual funds in India .
#Text=They are known for their relatively short 3-year lock-in period .
#Text=Because of their high liquidity and lucrative tax benefits , they ’re considered one of the best tax-saving investment schemes around .
#Text=By first choosing an investment scheme that ’s right for your financial goals , and choosing a distributor to invest with , you can invest your own money in ELSS .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Choosing the Right Investment Scheme
#Text=Invest in an ELSS with a low expense ratio .
#Text=A fund ’s expense ratio is essentially the amount of money that investors are charged by the fund management company for managing their investment .
#Text=Choose a scheme with a low expense ratio to save money while investing .
#Text=Expense ratios vary widely from firm to firm .
#Text=Research multiple management companies before determining which expense ratio is the lowest .
#Text=You can calculate expense ratio by dividing expenses incurred by the fund by its Assets Under Management ( AUM ) .
#Text=Use past performance and age to judge a fund ’s quality .
#Text=Although markets can be volatile , an ELSS fund ’s future performance can often be predicted by analyzing its past performance .
#Text=Invest in older funds with good performance records to better ensure the success of your investment .
#Text=Because markets are so unstable over time , older funds tend to have weathered more ups and downs than newer funds and thus tend to be more adept at surviving various market conditions .
#Text=Choose the growth option to maximize your profits over time .
#Text=There are 3 different options for investing in ELSS .
#Text=The growth option does not yield dividends and instead re-invests all of the fund ’s profits in the short-term , yielding a larger profit at the end of the ELSS tenure .

#Text=Because you wo n’t receive any of your investment ’s dividends , your profits with this option will depend entirely on market conditions during the 3 or more years you leave your money in the ELSS .
#Text=This option might be best for young people saving for retirement or for new parents saving money for their children ’s education .
#Text=Opt for the dividend option to see immediate profits .
#Text=Under this option , profits made by your ELSS are distributed to you on a timely basis instead of at the end of the investment tenure .
#Text=Go with this option if you want your ELSS to supplement your regular income .
#Text=Note that the benefits accrued under this option are tax-exempt .
#Text=This option is probably best for people who need a regular increase to their income in the short-term .
#Text=Go with a dividend reinvestment option to have more control .
#Text=A middle path between the growth option and the dividend option is the dividend reinvestment option .
#Text=This option will allow investors to choose whether or not to keep their dividends or return them to be reinvested in the ELSS .
#Text=This option may be best for market conditions that are not stable , as it allows you to keep money in a bear economy and reinvest it in a bull economy .
#Text=This is also sometimes called a “ growth-reinvestment option . ”
#Text=Investing Your Money
#Text=Open a bank account where your dividends will be credited .
#Text=This can be either a nationalized or a private bank .
#Text=Just make sure whatever bank you choose offers ELSS accounts .
#Text=Work with a mutual fund distributor if you do n’t want to do any work .
#Text=You ’ll need to select an intermediary to do your investing .
#Text=A professional mutual fund distributor will do all of the work for you , making this the best option for those who want to minimize the amount of work they do for their ELSS .
#Text=Mutual fund distributors will earn their commission from the fund house .
#Text=Note that by working with a mutual fund distributor , you lose much of your ability to choose how your money is invested .
#Text=Use an online distributor to be more involved in your ELSS .
#Text=Online distributors offer a variety of plans that will give you more options for retaining control over your investments and staying up-to-date on your ELSS .
#Text=Choose this option if you ’d rather take more personal responsibility for your investment .
#Text=Be advised that most online distributors charge a fee for each transaction .
#Text=Deposit your money in a lump sum to kick start your investing .
#Text=If you have a lot of money you want to invest right away , you might consider depositing it in your ELSS in a lump sum .
#Text=This will kick start your investment returns immediately , while also freeing you from having to think about your ELSS every month .
#Text=This option may be best for people starting out with a lump sum of money who ca n't rely on a regular income as a source of investment money .
#Text=Note that most experts generally advise against this .
#Text=Invest with a Systematic Investment Plan to save money long-term .
#Text=Using a Systematic Investment Plan ( SIP ) will spread out your investments and place money in your ELSS on a monthly basis .
#Text=SIP averages out the cost of your investments over the year , thus making sure that you ’re getting the best price possible .

#Text=For example , if costs are higher in February and lower in April , you will save money in the long-term by investing a little each month than if you invest all of your money in February or whenever costs are high .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Equity Linked Savings Schemes are distinguished by their short 3-year lock-in period .
#Text=However , to maximize your savings , plan to stay invested in your ELSS scheme far beyond those first 3 years .
